{{Infobox software | name = VistaPE | logo = [[Image:VistaPE logo.png]] | screenshot = [[Image:VistaPE Live CD.png|300px]] | caption = VistaPE booted off a [[Live CD]] | collapsible = | author = | developer = nightman | released = December 1, 2006 | latest release version = 12 RC1 | latest release date = 21.10.2008 | latest preview version = v12RC1 | latest preview date = {{release date|2008|10|21}} | frequently updated = | programming language = | operating system = | platform = the Live CD should run on any x86 computer | size = | language = | status = continued/under development | genre = | license = | website = [http://www.vistape.net/ www.vistape.net] }} '''VistaPE''' is a project (set of scripts) for [[WinBuilder]] to create a [[Live CD]] based on the [[Windows kernel|kernel]] of [[Windows Vista]].
VistaPE uses technology from and largely resembles [[Windows Preinstallation Environment]] 2.0 (from Microsoft), but has a graphical shell, expanded set of supported devices and functions, and can run almost any Windows program. ==Features== * Possibility to either fully or partially load VistaPE at startup into memory (boot.wim) * Support for a large number of SATA/RAID/SCSI/NIC drivers (thanks to the [[DriverPacks]] project). * Able to read and write NTFS/FAT32/FAT/Ext2/Ext3 partitions * Full networking support * Automatic hardware detection (PnP) * Booting from CD/HDD/UFD/Network * Compatibility with Microsoft Windows Vista * A wide range of programs and shells (Explorer, LiteStep, BS Explorer ...) * No limits regarding the maximum number of open processes * Automatic creation shortcuts for programs * Ability to remove VistaPE boot media while VistaPE is running (using boot.wim) * Full multilanguage support ==Portable applications== It is complicated to install applications on the RAM of a Live CD, and all the changes made to those programs and the installation itself will be lost once the computer is rebooted, so a good alternative is to use [[portable applications]], that can be run from either the Live CD, or from a [[USB flash drive]] connected to the computer; there is even software dedicated to create those portable applications ([[VMware ThinApp]], [[Virtual Application Studio]] or [[Portable application creators|others]]). ==Notes== The default Live CD is less than 200MB in size.{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} ==Gallery== Image:WinBuilder building VistaPE.png|[[WinBuilder]] building VistaPE Image:VistaPE Live CD Boot Screen.png|The Boot Screen of VistaPE Live CD Image:VistaPE Live CD loading.png|VistaPE Live CD loading ==See also== *[[BartPE]] *[[Reatogo-X-PE]] *[[nLite and vLite]] *[[Windows Preinstallation Environment]] *[[WinBuilder]] *[[Live USB]] *[[List of live CDs]] *[[VMware Workstation]] or [[VirtualBox]] to use a Live CD without [[Optical disc authoring|burning]] the [[ISO image]]. *[[Windows To Go]] [[Category:Operating system distributions bootable from read-only media]] [[it:VistaPE]] [[pt:VistaPE]] [[simple:VistaPE]]
